page.title: 09A Methodist Minister's Week
page.content: What does a minister do besides taking services? we asked the Rev.M. Johnson.His reply included such items as weddings,funerals,baptisms,circuit meetings,sick visiting,helping those with problems and raising money for the church and charities.Then there are church activities such as Junior Endeavour or Church Fellowship which, he said,are well attended. We found Springfield Church,built in 1869,to be attractively decorated and furnished.It was,he said,adequate for his needs,though he would welcome an extra Sunday School room. He is optimistic about the future of the church.Most public occasions attract smaller numbers these days but people still want to use churches at special times.Those attending services go through a desire to take part in worship,not because of coercion.
